intro: Hieracium flagellare subsp. amauracron, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to central and eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in grassy areas, meadows, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces slender, branching stems that bear numerous small, showy florets. This subspecies is notable for its ornamental value and its role in supporting pollinators in its native habitats.
